textCaptions.title: compute the amu of the molecule

Drag the correct ‘section titles’ and ‘start with’ items to the proper positions. Having a good handle on how to stay organized in working out stoichiometry problems will be important to learning to do them well.

slides.title: grams to moles, moles to grams

textCaptions.title: The show amu button will be clickable in the Try It section of the lesson.
Always check to be sure the equation is balanced. If it isn’t, balance it.
HINT:  To find the given just look for the substance that you have a quantity, or number, for.
HINT:  To find the ‘find’ just look for what you are to solve for - usually in a sentence that ends with quation mark.
HINT:  Click on same if your given and the find is for the same substance, different if there are two different chemicals for your given and your find.
Always check to be sure the equation is balanced. If it isn’t, balance it.
If you get stuck, click on the “Check Answer’button to see the steps of the solution.
Note: If your given and find are both gases, the number of moles is the same as the number of liters.
Always check to be sure the equation is balanced. If it isn’t, balance it.
